result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcellus L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All Court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All Court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or drugs.  No posession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemd necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcellus L Johnson

attys.name: De Los Santos, Gerardo Antonio, Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (30 pages) PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING, commencing APRIL 22, 2016,  received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Collisce J.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS 5 MONTHS with 459 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 5 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

 Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in court with attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 05/02/2016 is vacated.  Pursuant to negotiations Count 2 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion for bail reduction.

Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in court with attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:   City of Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Tanem.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for scheduling conference and bail motion  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Marcellus L Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing January 30, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch PE.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
